Key Match Events: Luka Doncic led all players with 37 points and nine assists.
John Collins led the Jazz with 28 points and nine rebounds.
Keyonte George and Kyle Filipowski had 14 points.
Dallas Mavericks lost their fourth straight game, all in clutch situations.
The Jazz's first home win of the season as they moved to 3-8.
Luka Doncic tied the game at 108-108 with a long three over Filipowski.
John Collins scored the game-winning basket with 6.5 seconds to go.
Naji Marshall missed the final shot, resulting in a 115-113 loss for the Mavericks.
Pre-Game Insights: Dallas Mavericks were searching for a win after losing their last three games in clutch situations.
Kyrie Irving was a late scratch with a shoulder sprain.
Jason Kidd shook up the starting lineup with Luka Doncic, Quentin Grimes, Klay Thompson, Maxi Kleber, and Dereck Lively II.
Utah Jazz started Collin Sexton, Keyonte George, Lauri Markkanen, Kyle Filipowski, and John Collins due to injuries to Taylor Hendricks and Walker Kessler.
Post-Match Reflections: Luka Doncic admitted to a costly mistake in the Mavericks-Warriors game.
Jason Kidd expressed frustration with the Mavericks' effort against the Suns.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks allowed 16 offensive rebounds, turned it over 17 times, and shot just 30.8% from the free-throw line.
The Mavericks return home to play the San Antonio Spurs on Saturday.
